action.action-desc: Mr. Mills introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To provide a 1-week extension of the public debt limit.

section.header: Temporary extension of public debt limit

subsection.text: Section 3101(b) of title 31, United States Code, shall not apply for the period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act and ending on June 12, 2023.

subsection.header: Special Rule Relating to Obligations Issued During Extension Period
subsection.text: Effective on June 11, 2023, the limitation in effect under section 3101(b) of title 31, United States Code, shall be increased to the extent thatâ€”

paragraph.text: the face amount of obligations issued under chapter 31 of such title and the face amount of obligations whose principal and interest are guaranteed by the United States Government (except guaranteed obligations held by the Secretary of the Treasury) outstanding on June 11, 2023, exceeds
the face amount of such obligations outstanding on the date of the enactment of this Act.

subsection.header: Restoring Congressional Authority Over the National Debt

paragraph.text: An obligation shall not be taken into account under subsection (b)(1) unless the issuance of such obligation was necessary to fund a commitment incurred pursuant to law by the Federal Government that required payment before June 11, 2023.

paragraph.header: Prohibition on creation of cash reserve during extension period
paragraph.text: The Secretary of the Treasury shall not issue obligations during the period specified in subsection (a) for the purpose of increasing the cash balance above normal operating balances in anticipation of the expiration of such period.
